intro: Sedum trollii, commonly known as the alpine stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its fleshy, upright stems and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow to orange. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Sedum trollii is often found in alpine meadows and is a hardy species that can withstand harsh winter conditions. Its compact growth habit makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine displays.
